descMeta.title: John Timberlake Gibson papers
descMeta.description: John T. Gibson was a writer, founder of Modern Design Incorporated, and owner and breeder of race horses. His papers consist primarily of financial, licensing, and registration records relating to Gibson's career as horse breeder and owner. The collection also include some magazine articles and manuscripts from Gibson's days as a freelance writer.

descMeta.description: A group photograph of the University of Maryland lacrosse team standing on the steps in front of Byrd Stadium, 1975. Caption reads: "Front Row (left to right): Andy Thompson, Bert Caswell, tri-captain Ed Mullen, tri-captain Gary Niels, tri-captain Doug Radebaugh, Gary Glatzel, Frank Urso and Brooks Sleeper. Second Row: Drew Tyrie, Jim Burnett, Jake Reed, Tom Murray, Bert Olsen, Bob Gilmartin, Bill Gould and Mike Robinson. Third Row: Mark Shores, Bryant Waters, Todd Beach, Tony Morgan, Bob Holland, Mark Bethmann, Mike Farrell, and Bob Brenton. Forth [sic] Row: Lin Wellender, Butch Pantelidez, George Miller, Bob Ott, Roger Tuck, Jim Bell, Wilson Phipps and Mark Tully. Top Row: Asst. Coach Rennie Smith, Head Coach Bud Beardmore, Asst. Coach Jim Dietsch, and Asst. Coach Kurt Kimball."

descMeta.title: Rennie Smith, University of Maryland lacrosse, 1955
descMeta.description: A photograph of University of Maryland lacrosse player Rennie Smith, 1955. Caption reads: "SMITTY BOWS OUT--Rennie Smith, one of four seniors on Maryland's lacrosse team, will play his last game for the Terps tomorrow against Johns Hopkins. Rennie was a second-team All-America choice in 1954 and is a good bet for first-string honors this season. An attackman who specializes in playmaking, Co-Capt. Smith is second to Charlie Wicker in assists with 19 and has scored 10 goals in Maryland's 10 consecutive victories this spring."
